alert.note: Alert for Central Chaffee County Below 9000 Ft; Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Chaffee County above 9000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:15AM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Chaffee County through 945 AM MDT... At 915 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Maysville, or 8 miles northwest of Poncha Pass, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Poncha Pass, Salida, Poncha Springs, Maysville and Nathrop. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
